snippet: The justices unanimously rejected arguments by Arkansas prison officials that said allowing beards would make it easier for inmates to hide contraband.
abstract: Supreme Court rules unanimously that correction officials in Arkansas violated religious rights of Muslim prisoners by forbidding them from growing beards; case relates to Gregory H Holt, also known as Abdul Maalik Muhammad, serving life sentence for burglary and domestic violence, who sought to grow half-inch beard.
lead_paragraph: The justices unanimously rejected arguments by Arkansas prison officials that said allowing beards would make it easier for inmates to hide contraband.

headline.main: Ban on Prison Beards Violates Muslim Rights, Supreme Court Says
headline.print_headline: Prison Beard Ban Violates Muslim Rights, Court Says
